name: idea-catcher
description: Twilio Serverless Functions project - Handles incoming SMS and processes transcriptions

comments.project-type: Twilio Serverless Functions - Cloud-hosted functions managed by Twilio

how-it-works.step-1: User sends SMS to your Twilio phone number
how-it-works.step-2: Twilio receives the message and triggers your serverless function
how-it-works.step-3: Your function in /functions/send-text.js processes the incoming data
how-it-works.step-4: Function sends a response back through Twilio
how-it-works.step-5: Response SMS is sent back to the user
how-it-works.no-server-needed: Twilio manages all servers - you only write functions

scripts-explained.npm-start: Runs 'twilio-run' - starts local development server at http://localhost:3000
scripts-explained.npm-run-deploy: Deploys your functions to Twilio's servers using 'twilio-run deploy'
scripts-explained.local-testing: Use 'npm start' to test functions locally before deploying

dependencies-explained.twilio: Twilio SDK - allows you to interact with Twilio services (SMS, calls, etc.)
dependencies-explained.runtime-handler: Handles the runtime environment for your Twilio functions

devDependencies-explained.twilio-run: Development tool - lets you run functions locally and deploy to Twilio

deployment.local: npm start → Functions run on your machine for testing
deployment.production: npm run deploy → Functions deployed to Twilio's servers (always running)
deployment.credentials: Uses .env file for ACCOUNT_SID and AUTH_TOKEN (never commit .env!)
